de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractListDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Dialog
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractValidateableDialog
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractButtonBarDialog
            • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractListDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MaterialDialog

    public abstract class AbstractListDialog
extends AbstractButtonBarDialog
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractListDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>
      An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.content.DialogInterface

        android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnKeyListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnShowListener

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.content.DialogInterface

        BUTTON_NEGATIVE, BUTTON_NEUTRAL, BUTTON_POSITIVE, BUTTON1, BUTTON2, BUTTON3

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractListDialog

        protected AbstractListDialog(@NonNull
                             android.content.Context context,
                             @StyleRes
                             int themeResourceId)
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contains list items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

    • Method Detail

      • getListView

        public final android.widget.ListView getListView()
        Returns the list view, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The list view, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the class ListView or null, if the dialog does not show any list items or has not been shown yet

      • getListAdapter

        public final android.widget.ListAdapter getListAdapter()
        Returns the adapter of the list view, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The adapter of the list view, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the type ListAdapter or null, if the dialog does not show any list items

      • getItemColor

        public final int getItemColor()
        Returns the color of the list items of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the list items of the dialog as an Integer value or -1, if no custom color has been set

        public final void setItemControlColor(int color)
        Sets the control color of the list items of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The control color, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if no list items are shown or if the dialog has not been shown yet

      • setItems

        public final void setItems(@NonNull
                           java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                           @Nullable
                           android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final void setSingleChoiceItems(@NonNull
                                       java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                       int checkedItem,
                                       @Nullable
                                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final void setSingleChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                                       int resourceId,
                                       int checkedItem,
                                       @Nullable
                                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final void setMultiChoiceItems(@NonNull
                                      java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                      @Nullable
                                      boolean[] checkedItems,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final void setMultiChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                                      int resourceId,
                                      @Nullable
                                      boolean[] checkedItems,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

                                            android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener listener)

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • onCreateContentView

        protected final android.view.View onCreateContentView(@NonNull
                                                      android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMaterialDialog
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to inflate the view, which should be shown as the dialog content. The method is only invoked, if no custom view has been set.
        Specified by:
        onCreateContentView in class AbstractMaterialDialog
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent of the view, which should be inflated, as an instance of the class ViewGroup
        Returns:
        The view, which has been inflated, as an instance of the class View, or null, if no view should be shown as the dialog's content
